text:
NIDDK,Prostate Enlargement: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia
How many people are affected by Prostate Enlargement: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia ?,"Benign prostatic hyperplasia is the most common prostate problem for men older than age 50. In 2010, as many as 14 million men in the United States had lower urinary tract symptoms suggestive of benign prostatic hyperplasia.1 Although benign prostatic hyperplasia rarely causes symptoms before age 40, the occurrence and symptoms increase with age.
